intro: Hypertelis angrae-pequenae, commonly known as the small-leafed Hypertelis, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its small, ovate leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
